Reviews.Title: Kodak M753
Reviews.Author: H. M. Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: Takes very good photos . Easy to use .small enough to fit in shirt pocket . Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Goicoechea
Reviews.Content: This is one economic camera but with an exelent performance, great flash and nice pics, its made of plastic but for the price its the best!!!

Reviews.Title: Not The Best
Reviews.Author: Sue "Susie"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kodak M753 six months ago, and I've got to say that I am very disatisfied. PROS: As for as looks it's eye appealing (important for most girls) and very tiny- pocket friendly. Has a wonderful panaramic feature I use often. Great for close up detail pictures. CONS: Indoor pictures usually always come out with orbs (I read it has to do with flash being too close to lens). Night outdoors pictures are grany and the colors come out a bit muted. My biggest problem is that I can't just take out my camera and shoot a picture. I constantly have to check and re-program my camera so that the mode I left it on is still the mode on the camera before I click. The reason is that the wheel on the top of my camera is very sensitive and the modes keep changing with out me wanting them to, just by puting it in it's case or in my purse. Low price but you get what you pay for...not much. I loved the last Canon I had so, I'm looking into buying a Canon next.

Reviews.Title: Needs bigger lens
Reviews.Author: Customer#29845
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Kodak C330 that had died. I wear out these cameras in a year or two, then buy a new one for $100 to $150 when they go. I expect some technical advances each time but feel the comparison is fair.This camera adds a big viewing screen and fast zooming when looking at stored pictures. An on-off button lets you keep it in the mode you use most, and avoids having it turn itself on when it is jostled in your pack or pocket. The slightly recessed power button is easy to use (without gloves, anyway.I take photos to document conditions for scientific experiments, so true color is critical as is close-up focusing. The Kodak image sensor has always served me very well for the former need, so I'm sticking with this brand. This camera does a good job with macro, and getting into the mode is easy. You can leave the dial on the top in that mode so it is selected when you turn the camera on.It has no regular viewfinder, so you are out of luck taking pictures outdoors in the sun.The main problem is that the lens does not gather enough light. The C330 had a bigger lens, so the pictures had more detail and depth of field. Even though the C330 has a 4MP sensor and the M753 has a 7MP sensor, pictures taken with the C330 are much better. The extra megapixels just give better resolved grains, not a better resolved image.I expect to replace this camera with one in the C series when it wears out.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M753 camera is really bad one
Reviews.Author: SKK
Reviews.Content: Believe me ... the pictures produced by this camera are all much worse than 4 mp one. I had tried all types of settings and zoom combinations in day-light, evening and checked against the 4 mp ones. Atlast I had to return it.though it is economical,the pictures are not clear and these pictures were almost same as 2 mp camera (of my blackberry phone).

Reviews.Title: no battery charger
Reviews.Author: N. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I have read the description twice and it dont mention you have to buy a battery charger seperate. Oh yeah, it  comes with usb cord that you can charge off of your computer but you have to leave computer on for 3 hrs. no Standby. I feel this is misleading.

Reviews.Title: I thought it was going to be OK, but then...
Reviews.Author: Funky Blue Rooster "the funky one"
Reviews.Content: i got a camera for Xmas and it broke so i had to return it and the only manly thing that was there was the M753. at first it took "crapp" pics but then i read the manual and now i am wowed. No Its not my Nikon D2 but its good

Reviews.Title: Pretty good gift!
Reviews.Author: Kerry E. Wilson, Esq.
Reviews.Content: Nice value for an attractive camera.  Should have come with wall charge cord though.  Had to buy that separately or always charge via computer (USB).  Overall, very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: rlparker1982
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I own this veruy camera.  He bought his in the copper color long before I bought mine in black, and we both love this camera.  it is the best digital camera either of us have ever used.  It is also very durable.  They have both been dropped onto hard surafces and they still work like brand new.  The picture quality is also top notch.  I carry mine everywhere I go which came in handy the other day when we were hit by a person who ran a red light. The pictures I took after the accident helped to show the insurance company how bad the damage is.  For the best quality photos, this camera is the one, just make sure to set it to the highest mega-pixel setting(just like with any other camera, the higher the better). You wont be able to take as many pictures, but I have an 8GB SDHC card in my camera so I'm not worried about running out of room.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Patti J. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to find this particular camera and was sure it would be as stated on the selling page.............but it came 1 week late and without parts like the plug for the computer to charge it so kinda useless for my daughter this Christmas unless  I go out and buy a docking station, of which, i have no funds left so I am hoping the seller sends me all the parts so the camera is useful..............VERY disappointed

Reviews.Title: It is OK...
Reviews.Author: A. Quintanilla "archbooks"
Reviews.Content: My fourth digital camera. I've taken really good pictures with this camera, however I think that with another camera they would be even better :p It does not really focus too sharp, so sometimes when you take a picture in that perfect moment it may be blurry. Good amount of sceen settings and good panoramic pictures. For the money you can get a better one I think.

Reviews.Title: almost perfect
Reviews.Author: slowe
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my c 330 which still works. I thought it was great; the lcd screen is a little fuzzy indoors, but that was mainly the only thing. Very sleek design.  Takes great close up pictures, and with it on fire work mode you get the fire works really clear. Really big screen.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with minor problems
Reviews.Author: K. Crenshaw "K. Crenshaw"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a replacement for an older Kodak Easyshare C330 (which was a great camera and just didn't have enough mega pixels for me). It's a great camera with bright colors, almost no lag between taking pictures, and I love the fact that it runs on a rechargeable battery instead of AAs. There are a few flaws: a very slow delete time (about 4 seconds); every once in a while, a single picture gets corrupted and when reviewing pictures, I get the error message "invalid format." There are a few other things that I can't remember, but nothing major. I pretty much love this camera and am glad I went with another Easyshare (ironic: I don't even use the easyshare function. Haha).

Reviews.Title: Best buy!
Reviews.Author: David Grinfeld "David Grinfeld"
Reviews.Content: I m very satisfied with this camera, very simple to operate and yet has all what is needed.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: R. M. Rivera
Reviews.Content: This camera is very sleek and compact. Made a wonderful gift. Great price!I have other Kodak Share cameras and (honestly) I like my other models more because they have view finders. This is still a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: They showed pictures taken from this camera, but this camera definitely didn't take them! Not as good as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for years, I loved it. Unfortunately I say loved because someone knocked my purse down and it landed directly on a hard floor where my camera was. Up until that, it had withstood the occasional drop from a normal standing distance. It takes amazing pictures for point and click. For those complaining about the quality, its not a pro camera. Its made for simple and quick snaps! Absolutely loved it, I'm looking to buy it again because I'm unhappy with my newer kodak digital camera I purchased. I never had any problems with the focusing (unless I was moving excessively of course) or the display. Speaking of the display, my newer cameras display is grainy and doesn't show what the picture will actually look like while this camera does! I would really recommend it to anyone who just likes to take pictures! The potential to edit the photos on third party software is unaffected by it just being 7 mp. The pictures come out very smooth and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Very good 10% of the time, very bad 90% of the time
Reviews.Author: 150 F3
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It has given me many great treasures of beautiful photography.The M753 is meant for sunny days. I love how clear and colorful my ISO 80 photos turn out. I use EV -0.3 and low color, then make minor adjustments later to saturate, reduce noise, and correct levels. It's a wonderful camera when you know its strengths.Thanks to another reviewer, I tried Fireworks scene mode for night photography. My photos were clear, colorful, and pleasing. The camera focused on street light lens flare in night landscape mode, so more than half my shots were badly out of focus. Fireworks mode (with a tripod and the 2 second delay) was the answer.Panoramas require a tripod and careful alignment. When you do them handheld, the 10 second delay between shots and the long delay after pressing the shutter button lead to obvious seams and totally unaligned photos. I like how the tripod mount is directly below the lens so I can rotate the camera on the screw for the best alignment.Black and whites in overcast daylight are lovely. The silvery world of soft shadows and reflecting puddles is very beautiful. It helps to let more light in in overcast conditions. EV +0.3 does the trick. EV +0.7 is wonderful for objects silhouetted against white skies. Black and white does not work well in sunlight, so I just shoot in low color at EV -0.3 and convert later.I use 3 megapixel mode to reduce noise. I've used an M753 for 2 years and am delighted with how well it performs. My affection for the camera has steadily grown over time. Never had a problem with purple fringing.Once or twice a month the lens fails to retract when powered down. I just cycle power and it corrects itself. I'm pleased with lens reliability. The recessed power switch button is thoughtfully designed and very reliable.I don't like the self timer feature. It has to be selected every time, so I have to bring up the menu and deal with the interface dozens of times when I just want to make a series of clear macros with the tripod. Kodak should just leave the self timer on like Canon and go back to normal shooting mode when the camera is turned off and on again.Picture quality is compromised and generally unspectacular, but the small size and light weight more than make up for it. I think photography is more rewarding when you learn equipment weaknesses and overcome them. I think of the M753 as a very, very good toy camera. It's capable of dazzling photographic brilliance in the right light. I learned a lot about photography by seeing good and bad M753 results and understanding how I could improve my success rate. It's fun to playfully experiment with extreme settings and intentionally get wrong looking photos. Doing it wrong helps you learn how to get it right when it counts.I can't recommend this model for everyone. It won't appeal to perfectionists. It's really noisy in low light and high ISOs, but the answer to those problems is using a tripod, adding light, and using black and white to at least eliminate chroma noise.The video mode is terrible. Blocky and unpleasant. Harsh light cannot be exposed properly. Audio has a constant high pitched whine that's impossible to digitally filter out later. Pathetic!But if you like walking around, taking clear still pictures of colorful things in sunshine, and know about basic camera adjustments (white balance, ISO, saturation, and exposure compensation), the M753 is a fun camera for casual use. It's pretty amazing to draw out full, vibrant color from my low color photos. Its pictures are very lovely on the web.Try using the lens at midrange. 64mm is very clear and impressive, with lovely foreground clarity and smooth bokeh of distant scenery. Full wide angle and full telephoto are good, but the middle focal lengths are very good.I feel no regrets about choosing this camera. The only things I'd change would be a Canon style self timer interface and less pixel density. 3 or 4 megapixels would be ideal. With 7, you're just recording random noise and superfluous detail.So, a mixed review, but those 3 stars are respectfully given. I really got more than my money's worth out of this handy camera. It enhanced my life and offered many wonderful experiences of enjoyment and creativity.

Reviews.Title: excellent merchandise and delivery
Reviews.Author: ash
Reviews.Content: the well packed item arrived well in time and has got our extreme satisfaction, very good quality-price ratio.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare m753
Reviews.Author: J. Sullivan "jake"
Reviews.Content: I am very unhappy with this camera. For the first few weeks/months, it took pretty good pictures and acted like the easy and cheap point and shoot we needed. After less than 6 months of use though, about 80% of the pictures turn out to be terrible. It acts like it forgot how to focus.The one saving grace for me on this one is that it takes really good video for a camera this size/price. I think it's listed as 12 or 15 fps but it really impressed me with it's quality and ability to pick up sound. Not enough to give it another star though. For most practical intents and purposes, this camera is a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Great and cheap!
Reviews.Author: A. Ramsay
Reviews.Content: perfect for my uses--artsy college student type photography. great options, really neat panorama capabilities. incredible price. only bad thing is, it doesn't come with card or case. no biggie.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jack Williams
Reviews.Content: This camera is a nice choice, it was fairly cheep and still able to do everything I want it to. All around good purchase

Reviews.Title: so easy to break
Reviews.Author: Akiyoshi Numata "redhook7"
Reviews.Content: I bougth this camera twice. but both of them broke somehow within two weeks even though I was carefully using them. I recomend not to buy this camera. You will waste your money. Personaly, I would not never want to buy a camera from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Amy L. Keaton Daniels
Reviews.Content: The Kodak camera has a lot of great features!  It's very user friendly and we love it!

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera good pictures
Reviews.Author: D. Lavere
Reviews.Content: The Kodak camera takes really good pictures.  It is also very easy to recharge.  It is small and easy to take on trips. You can download the pictures on the computer and share them with others.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Momof2boys "lindsay"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it takes the BEST pictures I have ever been able to take with a camera, I have a "shake" when I am taking pictures and this camera takes care of that, you can not tell I shake when you look at the picture.. I use this everyday and I can not complain, plus I love the color, I love all the choices you get like sound and quality. I bought a 4 GB card and now my camera holds from 4000 - 9999 pictures depending on the MP I choose to use.. Overall I am 100% satisfied and WOULD recommend this product..I hope everyone enjoys this camera as much as I do

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: D. Priest
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Kodak EasyShare M753 camera.  It is easy to use.I am President of the historical museum and I find this camera an excellent tool in preserving records of the items donated to our museumDolly Priest

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Colmenares "Jorge Colmenares"
Reviews.Content: When i buy the product, expected a regular Point and Shoot camera, but when it arrived ,was more than we expected, has rechargeable battery, the color is exelente, it is black, the photos are spectacular, very good quality videos and the autoflash is also good, thre is no white photos when the camera are near something ... well, it has a 3X zoom and only can customise a few things, as the incoming light ... But that can be expected is a Point and Shoot camera... Excellent product ... More than I expected ...

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera with decent quality
Reviews.Author: K. Taylor
Reviews.Content: We wanted a fairly simple camera with decent quality.  The Easyshare has delivered.  For the majority of functions you use there are clearly identified buttons.  No searching menus.  Picture quality is decent.

Reviews.Title: NIce Camera!
Reviews.Author: H. N. Bayindir "Hazar"
Reviews.Content: Not the best but It is a nice camera, easy to use... good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: M753 KODAK
Reviews.Author: S. Aggarwal "S.A."
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA GREAT SERVICE BY AMAZON & LAST BUT NOT LEAST GREAT PRICE SAVINGS  SA

Reviews.Title: por el precio y lo que hace vale la pena
Reviews.Author: Francisco Castillo "Francisco Castillo"
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE CAMARA PRACTICA PARA SALIR DEL PASO CON UNA REUNION NO ES PARA NADA PROFESIONAL PERO TIENE MUY BUEN PRECIO Y RESULTADO

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Nichelle "Nichele"
Reviews.Content: This was used (which I knew), and it's in great condition. However, the person/place selling it never stated whether it did or didn't come with a battery, charger or charger cord and a memory card. It was used not brand new, wouldn't you expect it to come with everything. I did and was disappointed. It was still less than purchasing a brand new one, that was my goal.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: Diane "Di"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a *horrible* lens on it and therefore takes terrible pictures - blurry, pixelated, etc.  I've had phones that took better pictures than this.  Please don't waste your money.  And if that weren't  bad enough - the LCD screen is extremely fragile and cracked simply by being in my purse.  Now I've got to get a new camera, and you can be sure I won't be getting a Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Rene S. GONZALEZ "Geraldo"
Reviews.Content: The camera is good choice whether you are a green taking picture, sometimes the pictures looks out-focus, I have tried my best but even that one o more pictures are not good. But is a good item.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: L. Boyle
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera a couple of weeks ago because our other Kodak finally broke and my daughter's birthday was coming up.  I had to have a camera.  I read a ton of reviews and looked at different models, but I was always very happy with my first Kodak EasyShare CX6330.  Most of the pictures I took of my daughter's birthday were grainy (since they were inside).  Very disappointing.  We also took it with us on vacation.  Still not happy with a lot of the pictures.  It took really well outside.  However, you were lucky if you could see what you were looking at since there is no viewfinder, just the LCD screen.  I am taking this camera back and looking for something else.  Pros:  Good price; Cons: grainy inside pictures; hard to see what you are taking a picture of in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: this camera shut
Reviews.Author: Einar Yessi
Reviews.Content: this camera shut, is a lot of problem, because i'm living in Guatemala City, and you do nothing.

Reviews.Title: What a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Lizzianne
Reviews.Content: My most beautiful 20 yr. old daughter received a comparable camera as a gift from her boyfriend.  I was impressed by the pictures it took.  However, she dropped it and it would no longer transfer through the USB cable.  She was devasted and couldn't bring herself to tell him.  Fortunately, I found this exact camera on Amazon and purchased the replacement.  I was happy, she was ecstatic and, as far as he's concerned, we'll take this to our graves!  lol  A purchase more precious than gold!

ProductInfo.Features:
The KODAK AF 3X Optical Aspheric Lens captures crisp details
3X optical zoom (35 mm equivalent: 37¿111 mm) gets you closer to what's important without reducing image quality
7.0 MP means you can make stunning prints up to 20 × 30 in. (50 × 76 cm)
5X continuous digital zoom gets you even closer
View your pictures in high-definition on an HDTV or other HD device
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M753 7 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom (Black)
